intro: Eriotheca crenulata, commonly known as the roughleaf eriotheca, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and hairy stems. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Eriotheca crenulata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests.
